programme.desc: Part one of two. A judge seeks Campion's help after no less than four murders are committed in his household during a single month. Peter Davison stars

programme.title: Campion
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert Campion solves the mystery of the judge who has apparently become a marked man. Peter Davison stars in the mystery drama series based on Margery Allingham's stories

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Mike and Beth take a long road trip to obtain divorce papers from his ex-wife, and Kristin and Daniel contend with the mysterious death of a man in a hotel room. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Case Histories
programme.desc: Part one of two. Troubled private investigator Jackson Brodie visits a regular client to help look for her lost cat - but the seemingly innocuous task takes a peculiar turn when her neighbours plead with him to find their sister, who went missing 30 years previously. However, his priorities become complicated when an old acquaintance arrives at his office. Crime drama, based on the novels by Kate Atkinson, starring Jason Isaacs and Amanda Abbington, with Sylvia Syms, Natasha Little, Fenella Woolgar and Phil Davis

programme.title: Case Histories
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jackson continues to investigate the disappearance of Olivia Land, and visits the murder victim's father Theo Wyre, who is devastated by Laura's death. The private detective also helps a mysterious seductress find her niece, despite being burdened with the knowledge his ex-wife is moving to New Zealand with his daughter. Crime drama, starring Jason Isaacs, Amanda Abbington and Natasha Little

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: A convicted paedophile is spotted taking photographs of children by Rebus and a close colleague, who apparently reacts badly to the incident as he turns up dead the next day. However, the distraught detective thinks there's more to it than plain suicide. He vows to get to the bottom of the mystery, but soon becomes distracted by a plea from an old girlfriend to find her missing teenage son. Gritty crime thriller, starring John Hannah, Mark Bonnar and Michelle Fairley

programme.title: Damilola, Our Loved Boy
programme.desc: In November 2000, 10-year-old schoolboy Damilola Taylor was attacked and fatally wounded in Peckham, south London, a death that shocked the nation. This feature-length drama reveals the personal stories behind the headlines, exploring Damilola's journey from Lagos to London, and showing how Richard and Gloria Taylor coped with their personal lives as well as the pressure of the media as they fought for justice for the killing of their son. Babou Ceesay, Wunmi Mosaku and Sammy Kamara star, with Robert Pugh

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Dale Smith investigates when a man is raped following a burglary, and feeling guilty over the way he dealt with Mickey Webb after his sex attack, pushes the victim to make a statement, although his credit cards soon reveal another side to the story. Gabriel Kent struggles to keep his composure when he has to tell a man his parents have been killed. Paul Nicholas guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As CID begin investigating a peeping Tom who has been secretly filming girls in a leisure centre changing room, Ramani de Costa is horrified to see her stepdaughter on one of his videos. Despite her personal involvement, the DS is determined to stay on the case _ but events soon take an even more shocking turn

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani de Costa is distraught over her stepdaughter Jasmin's rape, and when the girl admits she lied in her interview, the DS fears she'll be pulled apart in the witness box if the case goes to trial. Tony Stamp's Filipino girlfriend isn't impressed when he uses her in a sting operation to capture human traffickers, and Jim Carver confronts wife Marie after discovering she has been harassing June

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim Carver is recovering in hospital, where as well as coping with his injuries, he has to suffer the doubts of his colleagues and a stepson accusing him of battering Marie. He realises he can no longer stay married. Meanwhile, Gabriel Kent is desperate to cover up his frenzied attack on his colleague, but no amount of tampering with the evidence can make Gina Gold or Dale Smith believe his statement

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey Harman impresses Brandon Kane with her policing skills when they investigate a case involving an abandoned baby, and a spark begins to develop between them. Gina Gold and Dale Smith disagree over whether to tell June Ackland the truth about Gabriel Kent, while Samantha Nixon is on edge about her possible promotion to DI, and works hard to solve a mysterious death

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: After an unidentified burnt body is found near an RAF base, Gently works alongside Special Branch officers who suspect the victim was involved with the IRA. However, the discovery that a large cache of guns has gone missing turns the case into a hostage situation. Feature-length episode starring Martin Shaw as the 1960s Northumberland detective, with Lee Ingleby and Robert Glenister

programme.title: The Quiller Memorandum (1966)
programme.desc: Two British spies based in 1960s Berlin are murdered, seemingly by a mysterious neo-Nazi organisation. The secret service drafts in an American agent to investigate the killings and uncover the identity of the leader of the extremist group. Thriller, starring George Segal, Alec Guinness, Max von Sydow and George Sanders, with a script by Harold Pinter

programme.title: The Fourth Protocol (1987)
programme.desc: A KGB agent is sent on a secret mission to Britain, where he is to await a series of couriers. An insubordinate British agent demoted to overseeing airports intercepts one of the couriers and finds he is carrying a part from a nuclear bomb, leading him to suspect a plot to blow up a nearby American military base. Cold War thriller, starring Michael Caine and Pierce Brosnan

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Domestic disharmony ensues for the Meldrews as a routine trip to the garden centre starts a trail of turmoil including a scowling snowman, a laughing policeman and a mysterious saboteur. Christmas edition of David Renwick's comedy from 1994, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Angus Deayton

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: When the beaten body of wealthy German businessman Gunter Schmeikel is discovered in the harbour, Gently and Bacchus are forced to consider whether a barman's anti-German sentiments are a motive for murder. However, the case takes a sinister turn when a key witness to Schmeikel's death is revealed to be a killer trained by Army Special Forces. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Tim Healy

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: A teenager sets out to visit her favourite pop star but never returns. Witnesses claim they saw her going into his house, but he pleads his innocence in her disappearance. Offbeat detective drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Alan Davies

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: An eminent scientist on the brink of a major breakthrough in cancer research is found impaled on a razor-sharp samurai sword in his locked study. Jonathan and Maddie are called in to find out if this is a case of murder or an extremely elaborate suicide. Guest starring Annette Crosbie, with Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin

programme.title: Taggart

As the body parts build up Taggart finds himself no closer to the solution and the investigation leads them to a butcher who becomes a prime suspect. However, when he turns up dead, killed with the same gun as the dismembered corpse, it appears to be another dead end

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore finds items to patch up at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian, including a picnic rug, a set of chairs, a broken games table, and a vintage display cabinet

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef champions the food, history and culture of the county, foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moor's dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goat's cheese

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple to find a new home in Moray, and chats to residents of a village recognised as a world leader for sustainable and holistic community living

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a wooden desk used by a leading member of the Suffragette movement and a mannequin from an East End tailor's shop bombed in the Blitz

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win ¬£5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Gyles Brandreth on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Attenborough and the Mammoth Graveyard
programme.desc: David Attenborough joins a team of archaeologists and palaeontologists excavating a mammoth graveyard discovered by fossil hunters in the prehistoric riverbed of the Thames. The site has also led to the discovery of stone artefacts, providing an insight into the relationship between early humans and mammoths during the Ice Ages. Leading experts in the fields of evolution provide their insight into this unique vision of prehistoric Britain

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy arrives on the square and tries to go unseen while she searches for Kathy but her efforts are unsuccessful. Gina, George and Elaine transform the Vic into a Spanish fiesta for Anna's 21st birthday. Peter and Kathy have a heart-to-heart

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers and Jennifer Reoch present coverage of the annual spectacular at Edinburgh Castle featuring an array of global talent led by the famous Massed Pipes and Drums. Performers include the Trinidad and Tobago Defence Force Steel Orchestra, the Swiss Armed Forces Central Band, His Majesty the King of Norway's Guards and Drill Team, the US Air Force Band, and the RAF King's Colour Squadron

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Lorna has no intention of sleeping until she finds out what Aoife Cassidy knew. The town's laundry survivors campaign for justice, and Lorna discovers that Aoife spoke to another survivor. Colman and local guard Massey join forces to track down Father Percy's murderer. Key evidence has been destroyed, but Colman identifies his murder suspect as Aoife Cassidy, whilst Lorna's strange behaviour brings her to his attention

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Gary Neville hosts an extended episode of the current affairs quiz, with comedian Maisie Adam and presenter Richard Madeley joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Reading & Leeds Festival 2023
programme.desc: Billie Eilish returns to Reading Festival, this time to headline the Main Stage East, where on a sunny afternoon in 2019, she drew arguably the biggest crowd of the weekend. At just 21, she will become the youngest solo artist to headline the event. The LA alt-pop sensation has built a hugely dedicated fanbase, has two UK number 1 albums under her belt When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? And Happier Than Ever and recently joined a stellar cast on the Barbie movie soundtrack with hit What Was I Made For?

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day eight from Budapest, Hungary, including the women's marathon from 6.00, which was won by Ethiopia's Gotytom Gebreslase in Eugene in 2022. Plus, the decathlon continues with the 110m hurdles at 9.05 and the discus from 10.00

programme.title: Caribbean Food Made Easy
programme.desc: In Glasgow, Levi Roots tempts shoppers with an aromatic pineapple dessert, before taking to the seas to meet Mull fishermen. He also lays on the ultimate Caribbean cricket tea for two teams of hungry Yorkshiremen

programme.title: The Third Man (1949)
programme.desc: American writer Holly Martins goes to post-Second World War Vienna at the invitation of his old friend Harry Lime, only to find he has died. However, the author finds the circumstances surrounding his death fail to add up and goes in search of the truth - but is unprepared for the ugly secrets he uncovers. Carol Reed's thriller, written by Graham Greene, starring Joseph Cotten, Orson Welles, Alida Valli and Trevor Howard

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Northern Superchargers Women v Welsh Fire Women (Start-time 2.30pm). Live coverage of the women's eliminator, which comes from The Kia Oval, as the second and third-placed sides battle it out for a place in the final. Southern Brave edged out Trent Rockets by two runs at this stage of the 2022 tournament with the help of Nat Sciver's excellent innings of 72 off just 36 balls

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A special edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series and bringing brand new valuations and unexpected auctions. Paul Martin takes a journey down the River Tweed and uncovers the history of the unusual border town, Berwick-upon-Tweed

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Dr Xander Van Tulleken cruise across the Welsh border in a couple of large classic American motors, guided on their hunt for antiques by experts Irita Marriott and Serhat Ahmet. Xand and Serhat discover their shared love of ceramics and set out to find the perfect piece to take to auction, while Irita and Gethin face a battle for some porcelain pigs

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon are challenged to a cricket match by Warden Hodges, who has signed up a professional for his side. Featuring a guest appearance by former England and Yorkshire fast bowler Fred Trueman. Vintage comedy first shown in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe and Bill Pertwee

programme.title: Northern Soul at the Proms
programme.desc: Andi Oliver presents a concert from the Royal Albert Hall in which Edwin Outwater conducts the BBC Concert Orchestra in a celebration of Northern Soul club culture, which took English towns across the industrial north and the Midlands by storm in the 1960s and 1970s. Curated by Stuart Maconie and Joe Duddell, the show features singers Vula Malinga, Frida Touray, Natalie Palmer, Brendan Reilly Nick Shirm and Darrell Smith. Recorded on July 15

programme.title: Shania Twain at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection featuring all of the Canadian singer-songwriter's biggest moments from the BBC archives. Including live performances, her earliest UK TV appearances from the days of debut hit Still the One, and classics That Don't Impress Me Much and Man! I Feel Like a Woman!

programme.title: Madonna at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back at a selection of the singer's appearances on a range of BBC shows - from her first Top of the Pops appearance with Holiday in 1984 through to recent years. This collection covers the singer's journey from Material Girl to Queen of Pop. It captures how, over the years, her ability to combine charisma, controversy and classic pop tunes has made her a female icon and a true global superstar

programme.title: Madonna Rebel Heart Tour
programme.desc: Directors Danny B Tull and Nathan Rissman showcase the American pop singer's 2015-2016 world tour via as-live footage and candid behind-the-scenes coverage from the various venues that played host to the exuberant Queen of Pop. Includes performances of Madonna's most recent hits, along with classic tunes from throughout her decades-long career, such as Living for Love, Material Girl, Holiday, and an acoustic version of Like a Prayer

programme.title: Madonna: Truth or Dare (1991)
programme.desc: Documentary following the outspoken pop superstar's 1990 Blonde Ambition international tour, featuring candid behind-the-scenes and performance footage, including her raunchy and controversial stage version of early hit Like a Virgin. Featuring interviews with family members, plus guest appearances by Warren Beatty, Kevin Costner and Sandra Bernhard

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day nine from Budapest, Hungary, featuring the men's marathon from 6.00. Tamirat Tola of Ethiopia was the victorious athlete last year in Eugene, with his compatriot Mosinet Geremew finishing second and Bashir Abdi of Belgium taking bronze

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of day nine from Budapest, Hungary, featuring the men's marathon from 6.00. Tamirat Tola of Ethiopia was the victorious athlete last year in Eugene, with his compatriot Mosinet Geremew finishing second and Bashir Abdi of Belgium taking bronze

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a family-run sheep farm in Somerset that has hosted a a music festival every summer for the past 18 years, and helps out with preparations. She assists in preparing a mutton curry in the farm cafe kitchen for hundreds of campers, and uses wool from the sheep to stuff sofas. She also dips into the archives to present some memorable features on rural music

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt takes a look back at some of his favourite recipes and best moments from Saturday Kitchen

programme.title: Mary Berry's Quick Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates recipes that deliver on flavour but save on time, inspired by the cuisine and cooking culture of places she visits. Mary beginning by making her first-ever visit to Rome to explore a cuisine that she has always adored, trying a new take on traditional pizza, uncovering a hidden gem in the Jewish quarter and cooking a speedy Roman classic with Michelin-starred chef Cristina Bowerman. Mary also whips up bruschetta, speedy pasta dishes and an irresistible tiramisu

programme.title: Strawbridge Over the Drawbridge
programme.desc: James Strawbridge visits Greyabbey House, home of Bill and Daphne Montgomery, and is taken on a tour after arriving by a rather unusual method of transport. He discovers that the reason the Montgomery family was given land in Greyabbey was all down to a large piece of cheese, and hears the tale of Bill's unfortunate relative who met a dastardly death at the hands of a pirate

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice (1940)
programme.desc: A couple are keen to find suitable husbands for their five daughters. When a wealthy gentleman and his friend arrive in the area, it leads to an encounter between headstrong daughter Elizabeth and aloof gentleman Mr Darcy, and their instant dislike gradually turns into an unexpected romance. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, starring Laurence Olivier and Greer Garson

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: The Women's Final (Start-time 2.15pm). Live coverage of the first of today's showpiece matches from Lord's. Oval Invincibles have won both previous stagings of this competition, twice overcoming Southern Brave in the final, with South African all-rounder Marizanne Kapp claiming two player of the match awards. Isa Guha presents, with analysis from Carlos Brathwaite and Michael Vaughan

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: The Men's Final (Start-time 6.00pm). Live coverage of the conclusion of the campaign, which comes from Lord's. Trent Rockets were the victorious team last year, defeating Manchester Originals by two wickets in the final with the help of Sam Cook's excellent bowling figures of 4/18 from 20 balls. Isa Guha presents, with analysis from Carlos Brathwaite and Michael Vaughan

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Mike is at a luxurious ¬£5million property he's hoping to sell to a top music producer, while Georgie hopes she can finally get her first sale. In New York City, the top two rookies are invited to the agency's yearly summit, where they have to make an impromptu speech in front of 200 brokers. After this toe-curling experience, they meet two of CEO Eddie's top performing brokers who grill them to see them if they've really got what it takes to make it in the Big Apple

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More (1965)
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee and Chris head to Derby to help Bal and her family restore her late mum's garden to its former glory. With a budget of ¬£6,500 the pair aim to make a colourful, Indian-inspired space where the family can gather and watch Bollywood movies on their outdoor cinema screen

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph finds a pair of tired chairs, a collection of garden cast-offs and a chest of drawers for her and the team to rejuvenate at Altrincham Recycling Centre

programme.title: Henpocalypse!
programme.desc: The hens face an unpleasant surprise in a mini-mart in Snowdownia and mother-of-the-bride Bernadette tries to turn the situation to their advantage. In an hour of need, one of the hens receives help from a national treasure

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: The investigators expose an organised scamming network and look into some false insurance scams with footage that proves the claimant is lying

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals how to take cuttings from herbs and prunes summer raspberries. He also plants daylilies and gives topiary Nigel a timely trim. Adam Frost travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet, and windy weather

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter discusses the many bugs, blights and diseases that can attack plants. She addresses what they are, the damage they can do, and how best to stop them. Diana Yates will be reviewing her own vertical garden area that demonstrates planting ideas for those with small gardens and balconies

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive is in Venice, where he wants to see what it's like to be a local, outnumbered by tourists by more than 200 to one. He starts out by learning the art of the gondolier, and soon learns that steering with just one oar is much more difficult than it looks. He then gets a lesson in glass-blowing and picks peppers on a farm in the Venetian lagoon

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops in Wolverhampton, where he finds out about the impact of Enoch Powell's 1968 speech. He also visits Kingsford Country Park on the outskirts of Kidderminster, investigates pigeon-racing in Worcester, and eventually looks into Cheltenham's jazz festival

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Rachel Burden takes viewers' calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win ¬£10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz show in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin is in Liverpool, teaching shop manager Dean Brittles and mosaic artist Freya Levy the tricks of the antiques-buying trade to see who can make the most profit

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's finals week as the eight winners of the regional heats do battle to get their dishes on the menu for the banquet celebrating British popular music, held at Abbey Road Studios. The chefs begins with the starter course, with Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver joined by guest judge Martin Kemp of Spandau Ballet

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist continues to explore the secrets behind evolution, this time focusing on the animal kingdom's bizarre hybrids, including the 'pizzly bear', a cross between a polar bear and a grizzly, which is thought to have come into being as a result of global warming. He also covers the killer bee brought into existence due to the transfer of African bees to South America

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his early 20th century Bradshaw's Guide, Michael Portillo sets off on the first leg of a trip through Britain's industrial heartlands in the footsteps of George V, beginning by travelling from Warrington to Preston

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Croome stately home in Worcestershire, where experts Natasha Raskin and David Fletcher scour the crowds to find objects to take off to auction. Natasha gets her hands on some ceremonial gold epaulettes, and David assesses an unusual vase shaped like a peacock. Paul learns about the secret research that took place at RAF Defford, which was based at Croome during the Second World War

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jennie McAlpine, Ugo Monye, Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward go toe to toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Marcus Wareing's Tales from a Kitchen Garden
programme.desc: The Michelin-starred chef explores new possibilities at his East Sussex smallholding, heading off to the Knepp in Horsham to learn all about different tomato varieties in its impressive market garden. After losing some of his ducks to foxes, Marcus is determined to keep the rest safe and local expert Tom. has interesting and unexpected ideas, including introducing some noisy new arrivals

programme.title: Chris and Meg's Wild Summer
programme.desc: Chris Packham and his stepdaughter Meg McCubbin go on a wildlife-watching road trip, setting off in a camper van to travel through some of the last untouched wildernesses in Britain. Their journey starts in Pembrokeshire, where the duo set sail for Skokholm island in pursuit of the perfect photograph of a puffin, then head north for an early morning canoe trip down the tranquil River Teifi, hoping to catch a glimpse of the elusive otter

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie returns with the quiz, inviting the first four contenders to the famous black chair. They answer questions on the specialist subjects of the geography of the Poirot novels of Agatha Christie, the Calvin and Hobbes cartoons, Drake, and Red Clydeside, before getting a chance to demonstrate the depth of their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as Midlands team the Mercians take on the Volunteers. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Sharp taste, Words set to music, Merciless character, and Solo character

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Amol Rajan asks the questions in another first-round match, with four students from the University of East Anglia pitting their wits against a team from the University of Strathclyde in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition

programme.title: Murder Trial: The Disappearance of Renee and Andrew MacRae
programme.desc: First of a two-part programme giving an account of one of the biggest unsolved murder cases in Scottish legal history. On trial at Inverness High Court is 80-year-old William MacDowell, who stands accused of killing his former lover Renee MacRae and her three-year-old son in 1976, disposing of their bodies and concealing the murders for 45 years. With in-court access to one of the most long-awaited court cases in Scotland's history, the documentary sits alongside both prosecution and defence as they detail the dramatic twists and turns of this shocking case

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: It's Sunday in the house of the couch-potato clan and Nana calls round. Denise tries on her wedding dress, but nothing can stand in the way of Antiques Roadshow. Award-winning comedy, written by and starring Caroline Aherne and Craig Cash, following the lives of a working-class Manchester family and set almost exclusively in their living room. With Ricky Tomlinson, Sue Johnston and Liz Smith

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.title: Predator: The Secret Scandal of J-Pop
programme.desc: Mobeen Azhar investigates the untold story of Japanese pop mogul Johnny Kitagawa and the allegations of sexual abuse against him by some of the boys in his talent agency. Despite the claims, the Japanese media has remained largely silent, even after the music mogul's death in 2019. Mobeen visits Japan to speak to those who say Kitagawa abused them, and find out how the allegations have affected his legacy

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani visits a family-run sheep farm in Somerset that has hosted a a music festival every summer for the past 18 years, and helps out with preparations. She assists in preparing a mutton curry in the farm cafe kitchen for hundreds of campers, and uses wool from the sheep to stuff sofas. She also dips into the archives to present some memorable features on rural music

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Actors Amy Walsh and Michael Praed, rapper and philanthropist Apl.de.Ap, dancer Dianne Buswell and reality star Luca Bish compete in the final week of heats. Faced first with the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient to incorporate into a meal for judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace before preparing their Dinner Party Dishes

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles, Mehreen Baig and a team of experts explore spectacular coastlines linked by the Irish Sea, and meet the people who call them home. The first programme focuses on the Merseyside coast, which stretches from Sefton Sands in the north to Wirral in the south, via the port city of Liverpool

programme.title: Ray Mears' Northern Wilderness
programme.desc: The survival expert embarks on a journey through the Canadian wilderness. His adventure begins in the boreal forest at the heart of the country, which is home to a diverse population of animals and plants. On the way he learns about the people who once lived in the area, and uses his specialised skills to survive in the inhospitable environment

programme.title: DNA
programme.desc: Rolf tries to build a relationship with his daughter in Paris but is warned to stay away. Danish crime drama, starring Anders W Berthelsen. In Danish and English

programme.title: DNA
programme.desc: Mario is sold into hard labour but plans to escape. Danish crime drama, starring Anders W Berthelsen. In Danish and English

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: An interview with George Michael first broadcast in 1998, in which he opens up about his childhood, his early musical career and his arrest in Hollywood in April 1997

programme.title: Parkinson: The Interviews
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson looks back on his meeting with Ingrid Bergman - an actress he confesses to falling in love with the first time he saw her on screen at his local cinema

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: The dropping of the atom bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki bring the war to an end, but Oppenheimer's new status as a national hero is short-lived

programme.title: Oppenheimer
programme.desc: A few years after the war, Oppenheimer finds himself regarded as a security risk, and must face a committee. Biographical drama about J Robert Oppenheimer, starring Sam Waterson

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank and Betty travel to the seaside for a second honeymoon, hoping to make up for the catastrophes of the first. All seems to be going to plan - until they reach the hotel. Classic comedy, starring Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice. Originally broadcast in 1973

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Cutbacks to the civil service threaten the permanent secretary's position so Sir Humphrey tries to manipulate Hacker into abandoning his new policy. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles, Mehreen Baig and a team of experts explore spectacular coastlines linked by the Irish Sea, and meet the people who call them home. The first programme focuses on the Merseyside coast, which stretches from Sefton Sands in the north to Wirral in the south, via the port city of Liverpool

programme.title: Mozart at the Proms
programme.desc: Two performances of Mozart concertos from the 2006 Proms, which marked the 250th anniversary of the composer's birth. Soloist Julian Bliss delivers the Clarinet Concerto, and American pianist Richard Goode performs Piano Concerto No 23, accompanied by the BBC Symphony Ochestra, conducted by Jiri Belohlavek

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Georgia Mann introduces the Mindful Mix concert from the Royal Albert Hall, with a capella group VOCES8 performing music from Radiohead, American composers Eric Whitacre and Philip Glass, and 450-year-old English choral music by William Byrd. Featuring the world premiere of Roxanna Panufnik's Floral Tribute, in memory of Queen Elizabeth II

programme.title: The Great Mountain Sheep Gather
programme.desc: Documentary following a shepherd's journey from summit to valley as he leads his sheep off Scafell Pike, reflecting on life caring for his flock in this rugged landscape. Maxine Peake reads specially commissioned poetry written by Mark Pajak to provide a counterpoint to the shepherd's insights throughout the film

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc: Life in the German capital in the year the Second World War ended, told through the stories of those who experienced it - from ordinary Germans to the Allied forces who entered the city. At the beginning of 1945, Berlin remains under the spell of the Nazi promise of salvation, an illusion at odds with the city's daily reality of bombing raids, fires to be extinguished and corpses to be buried. Life goes on as the front lines of the war close in each day

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski takes his appraisal of different stages of human evolution into the 20th century, assessing the realisation among physicists that there is no such thing as absolute certainty

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski traces the history of genetics, from the early experiments of Gregor Mendel to the discovery of the structure of DNA, offering his own views on human sexuality

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The first of two programmes originally shown to mark the 80th birthday of acclaimed actor and director Richard Attenborough, celebrating his long career in showbusiness, from his renowned portrayal of gangster Pinkie in Graham Greene's Brighton Rock to his white-haired Dr John Hammond in Jurassic Park. With contributions from friends and family. First shown in 2003

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Part two of two. Profile of acclaimed actor and director Richard Attenborough, charting his long career in showbusiness and following his day-to-day life as he visits a Leicester disability centre and addresses the students of Sussex University. With contributions from David Attenborough, John Attenborough, Sheila Sim and Ben Kingsley. First shown in 2003

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Tynemouth on the first leg of a trip to Berwick-upon-Tweed, hearing about of a 19th-century tragedy at sea that inspired 140 local men to set up a coastal rescue service. At Long Sands beach, Michael rolls up his sleeves to help volunteers caring for sick and injured seals at the Tynemouth Aquarium Seal Hospital

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle is joined by expert climber Lucy Creamer to scale Lincoln Cathedral, which was built in the 12th century, and was once the tallest structure in Britain. During their ascent, the pair marvel at the skill of the craftsmen responsible for creating the building's many features, including the Dean's Eye stained-glass window and the city's famous evil imp

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: The north of England is so rich in archaeological finds that Alice Roberts travels back there once again to reveal more of its fascinating history. She and the team examine a Roman fort on Hadrian's Wall, evidence of early writing by the Picts in Scotland, and a 3,000-year-old Bronze Age coffin buried under a golf course

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: Continuing his exploration of the collision of the West and Pacific culture, art historian Dr James Fox looks at how the West has created a vision of Polynesia as paradise. He travels across the Pacific to uncover the great sites and masterpieces of pre-contact Polynesian art, from the massive religious complex Taputapuatea on the island of Raiatea to the extraordinary feathered Ku heads from Hawaii, testament to the rich and sophisticated societies that once lived there

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian examines how key moments in Britain's history have been manipulated and mythologised, beginning with a look at the founding myths of the Reformation. She argues that Henry VIII may have had deeper motives for bringing about a religious and political schism than his desire for a divorce, and in doing so, laid the foundations for our modern constitution and economic power as an empire. She also questions the monarch's supposed belief in Martin Luther's Protestant revolution

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: In the final episode, psychotherapist Philippa Perry explores ghosts, science and early cinema in the 1890s, and how the late Victorian passion for science co-exists with a deeply held belief in the paranormal

programme.title: Berlin 1945
programme.desc: The second episode looks at the final downfall of the Nazi regime following Hitler's suicide and the disassembling of the Wehrmacht, and examines how life changed for the people of Berlin under occupation by the victorious Soviet army

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Tynemouth on the first leg of a trip to Berwick-upon-Tweed, hearing about of a 19th-century tragedy at sea that inspired 140 local men to set up a coastal rescue service. At Long Sands beach, Michael rolls up his sleeves to help volunteers caring for sick and injured seals at the Tynemouth Aquarium Seal Hospital

programme.title: Climbing Great Buildings
programme.desc: Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle is joined by expert climber Lucy Creamer to scale Lincoln Cathedral, which was built in the 12th century, and was once the tallest structure in Britain. During their ascent, the pair marvel at the skill of the craftsmen responsible for creating the building's many features, including the Dean's Eye stained-glass window and the city's famous evil imp

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: The north of England is so rich in archaeological finds that Alice Roberts travels back there once again to reveal more of its fascinating history. She and the team examine a Roman fort on Hadrian's Wall, evidence of early writing by the Picts in Scotland, and a 3,000-year-old Bronze Age coffin buried under a golf course

programme.title: Royal History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian examines how key moments in Britain's history have been manipulated and mythologised, beginning with a look at the founding myths of the Reformation. She argues that Henry VIII may have had deeper motives for bringing about a religious and political schism than his desire for a divorce, and in doing so, laid the foundations for our modern constitution and economic power as an empire. She also questions the monarch's supposed belief in Martin Luther's Protestant revolution

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles, Mehreen Baig and a team of experts explore spectacular coastlines linked by the Irish Sea, and meet the people who call them home. programme.title: Ray Mears' Northern Wilderness
programme.desc: The survival expert embarks on a journey through the Canadian wilderness. programme.desc: The Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest structure of living organisms and 1,400 miles long, is home to the most diverse population of undersea life on the planet‚Ä¶ and it's under attack! In an epic story torn from the headlines, the Octonauts embark on their largest, most complex rescue mission ever: saving the Great Barrier Reef and all the creatures that live there from an invasion of coral-hungry crown-of-thorns starfish. The Octonauts meet a tiny coral polyp looking to find a home on the very same reef where the Octonauts are deploying their new medical base, the Gup-W, and the Gup-P, a specialised first responder emergency vehicle. programme.desc: Observational documentary on the lives of reception children at two contrasting primary schools - one rural, and one urban

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: Chip sings a heartfelt song about being a potato

programme.title: Andy's Aquatic Adventures
programme.desc: Andy works at Safari World, the biggest and best safari park on the planet, home to animals from all over the globe. He works there with his boss, Mr Hammond and tech wizard Jen

programme.title: Get Set Galactic
programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this-world prizes. First, the teams must identify objects using just one of the five senses. Then, there‚Äôs a fast-paced game based on personal hygiene. Finally, the teams must take items from a giant conveyor belt and sort them so they can be reused and recycled. To make it even trickier, the players are attached to bungee cords! Ayo‚Äôs new detective mystery book goes missing, so she searches for fingerprints to discover who‚Äôs borrowed it

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels do everything at the clubhouse, from reading and drawing, to running and dancing, and tire themselves out, so Duggee suggests they have a break with a story

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When Peter promises the Shrew some worms to entice him to Cotton-tail's birthday party, he ends up accidentally putting everyone in danger. Adventures with the animal and his friends, in a tale inspired by Beatrix Potter

programme.title: Grace's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Motorbike rider Grace is in the driving seat as she introduces the pre-school audience to some of the biggest, fastest and most amazing machines in the world

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When all the Gups go out of control, Barnacles and Kwazii round them up by riding on speedy Sailfish

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey, Bingo and Dad always take out the bins

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo is desperate to show off her handstand skills

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea asks Broccoli for flying lessons, but doesn't let her know that she intends to fly high to take over Tato Tower

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: There's a storm brewing after Glitch's fake weather report puts the cadets in danger.

programme.title: Room on the Broom
programme.desc: Animated adaptation of the children's book by author Julia Donaldson and illustrator Axel Scheffler, the creators of modern classic The Gruffalo. It tells the story of a kind witch who invites a surprising number of animals to ride on her broom - much to the frustration of her cat. But when a fearsome dragon appears, what will the gang do? Gillian Anderson heads the voice cast as the witch, with Rob Brydon, Martin Clunes, Sally Hawkins and David Walliams as the animals, Timothy Spall as the dragon and Simon Pegg as narrator

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Sarah is keen to complete her sticker album, so sets off to see if her friends can help with her collection

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran are planning on baking a sweet banana loaf for Jared, who‚Äôs coming to Gran Gran‚Äôs house for dinner. But as they get the ingredients ready, Gran Gran realises the bananas are still green, which means they can‚Äôt make a sweet loaf. Great-Gran Gran shares another green recipe ‚Äì a tomato salad. Maybe there‚Äôs another Caribbean dish with unripe bananas that JoJo can make for Jared

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: In the Toy House Colly Wobble is looking in the mirror, trying out her funny walk

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Major Clanger invents a machine for cleaning up the planet. When he gets called away by Granny, Small and Tiny try it for themselves - and soon get into difficulty. Narrated by Michael Palin

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: In a magical forest, colourful characters have adventures. The Pontipines and the Wottingers are out for a walk in the garden. Mrs Pontipine spots something through her binoculars - it is the Ninky Nonk! Makka Pakka, Upsy Daisy and Igglepiggle all join the Pontipines and Wottingers for a ride on the Ninky Nonk.

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Presenter Annie Price tells the tale of a little girl who forms an unusual friendship‚Ä¶ with a dinosaur!

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Karan Gokani and Poppy O'Toole plus special guest Munya Chawawa. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn, and Dougie Vipond focus on Scottish lamb, cooking spicy Moroccan lamb chops with grilled veg couscous. Joining them in the kitchen are Sutherland Sheep Farmer Joyce Campbell and food and drink writer Rosalind Erskine, who's mixing and pouring a Shetland gin Southside cocktail

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Arsenal v Fulham and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest. Plus, news from Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur

Eric Knowles monitors proceedings and also challenges the crowds to guess the function of an intriguing piece of Victorian paraphernalia

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall recycling centre on a mission to save three unwanted items, rescuing a well-used table, a retro chair and rusty gate rods from the skip

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Philip and Lorraine in Stockport want to transform their forgotten plot into a stately garden, on a budget of ¬£4,750, with secret passageways, big urns, a beautiful tiled patio and lots of posh planting. Charlie Dimmock takes on the Rich Brothers to come up with a design that would not look out of place in a stately home.

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of Dai Chant, the former coxswain of the St David's Lifeboat, who has since suffered a stroke. His son discovered that objects connected to the sea stirred up old memories, so helps him to return to the sea for the first time in 30 years, and to revisit the scene of his most terrifying rescue, when in 1989, a fishing boat lost control close to the rocks beneath the Bishop Rock Lighthouse

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Documentary following ice swimmer Cath Pendleton and her dream of swimming a mile in the coldest continent on the planet - Antarctica. A health worker with no real money or support team behind her, her training regime involves sitting in a chest freezer in the garden shed. Will her determination be enough to achieve her dream?

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Kelly Somers presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the evening session on day eight from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are up for grabs in seven events. The decathlon concludes with the javelin from 6.05 and the 1500m at 8.25, and Great Britain will expect to be in contention in the men's and women's 4x100m relays at 8.40 and 8.50 respectively given the wealth of talent at their disposal. The other finals are the men's pole vault at 6.25, the women's shot put from 7.15, the men's 800m at 7.30 and the women's 5,000m, at 7.50

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Fulham at Emirates Stadium and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest at Old Trafford. The Gunners are aiming to finish one better than last term when they were runners-up, but faced a potentially tough test against a Fulham side that performed well last term. The Red Devils and Forest met four times in all competitions last season, with United winning every contest. Plus, Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Everton v Wolverhampton Wanderers, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United and Chelsea v Luton Town

Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton discuss whether Britain should pay slavery reparations and if drug use should be decriminalised. Plus, the surprising power of roller skating

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Thirty-three-year-old Kiran is looking for a life partner and has decided to lean on her Sikh faith and community to help her find the one. Kiran's parents had an arranged marriage 47 years ago and are happy to put out feelers among friends and relatives. Kiran also visits a matrimonial service at her temple, talks to two different types of Sikh matchmaker and goes to a Sikh speed-dating event. Will she find love?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell follow progress on a bungalow in Cabus, Lancashire, and a three-storey house in Newport, Wales

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Oswestry Showground in Shropshire, with experts Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper, before seeing items go under the hammer with auctioneer Charles Hanson. Natasha also looks at the history of buying gifts for special occasions and finds that antiques fairs can the best place to buy that special wedding or christening present.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley marks the 300th anniversary of Christopher Wren's death by exploring some of the city churches in London designed by this master architect, including some of the 52 he was charged with rebuilding after the Great Fire. Gemma Hunt joins a group of children who are spending the day at one of his churches

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a couple look for a new home in the Welsh countryside with business potential for holiday lets or glamping

programme.title: The Boss Baby (2017)
programme.desc: A youngster believes his baby brother is actually a power-hungry tycoon sent to destroy his perfect family life. However, the duo must put aside their differences and work together when they uncover a plot to sabotage the company their parents work for. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Alec Baldwin, Steve Buscemi, Jimmy Kimmel and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Having been raised Welsh by his adoptive white parents, Gerallt Wyn Jones finds the courage to go looking for his birth parents. In 1973, born black to a white unwed mother, Gerallt was given away when he was only a few weeks old. Raised speaking Welsh in a very white north-west Wales, he has always felt different to everyone. Almost 50 years on - and fearing he may have left it too late - he can't hold back any longer from searching for the black father and heritage he's never known, and for the young white mother who felt she had no choice but to give him away

programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: Documentary following real-life Kings and Queens of the road as they help stack the nation's shops, shelves, construction sites, fuel tanks and kitchen cupboards. The series focuses on the team members at Owens - one of the oldest and biggest haulage companies in Wales. From their base in Llanelli, they run a network that spans the UK, providing hundreds of jobs and turning over ¬£170million a year. In this episode, veteran trucker The Donk has an anxious wait on his wedding anniversary, new recruit Laura puts her reversing skills to the test and MD Ian battles with rocketing fuel bills

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Matt Baker head to the Usk Valley within Bannau Brycheiniog, and look at a series of projects which aim to lead the National Park into a more sustainable future. However, not everyone has welcomed this change. Plus, Charlotte Smith investigates if the race to protect land for nature could threaten livestock farms, and Adam Henson introduces the first two competitors for this year's one man and his dog competition

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Live coverage of the evening session on day nine from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, as the championships conclude. In the 800m at 7.45, Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson will hope to go one better than in last year's championships, when she took silver behind USA's Athing Mu. Finals also take place in the women's high jump from 7.05, the men's 5,000m at 7.10, the men's javelin from 7.20, the women's 3,000m steeplechase at 8.10, the men's 4x400m relay at 8.37 and the women's 4x400m relay at 8.47

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Mystery, starring Ruth Wilson as Lorna Brady, who wakes from sleepwalking to find a corpse in her house. She has no idea who the dead woman is or if she's responsible for the apparent murder. Re-tracing her steps, Lorna realises that the mysterious woman could be linked to her past in the town's Magdalene Laundry. Meanwhile in Dublin, Detective Colman Akande is confronted with the murder of a local priest. Tracking the case brings him into Lorna's orbit

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Newcastle United v Liverpool, Sheffield United v Manchester City and Burnley v Aston Villa. Liverpool overcame the Magpies home and away last term, but Newcastle still beat them to a top-four spot. The Blades faced a tough test against a City side that overcame them 3-0 in the semi-finals of last season's FA Cup, while another newly promoted side in Burnley were looking for a strong display against Unai Emery's men. Plus, a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Reading & Leeds Festival 2023
programme.desc: The Killers return to the Reading Festival to headline for the second time, having first graced the top spot back in 2008. Nearly 20 years on from the release of their debut album Hot Fuss, expect a setlist full of huge sing-a-long anthems and indie disco classics from the band's seven-strong back catalogue of albums

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Two RAF aircraft are sent to save the life of a sailor in the Atlantic. Essex police film dangerous drivers from an HGV, and a paramedic is the victim of a terrifying assault

programme.title: Expert Witness
programme.desc: A facial recognition expert helps Merseyside Police catch a killer, and a specialist palynologist's help is needed by detectives investigating an elderly couple's disappearance

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the stories of a small apartment in Edinburgh's Haymarket, a three-bedroom terrace in Newcastle-under-Lyme and a grand detached house in Carlisle, complete with an annexe and a walled garden

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is in Kingston in Surrey, where the teams are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. While the competition hots up, Eric gets on his bike at the Herne Hill Velodrome

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore finds items to patch up at Wallyford Recycling Centre in East Lothian, including a picnic rug, a set of chairs, a broken games table, and a vintage display cabinet

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef champions the food, history and culture of the county, foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moor's dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goat's cheese

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple to find a new home in Moray, and chats to residents of a village recognised as a world leader for sustainable and holistic community living

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a wooden desk used by a leading member of the Suffragette movement and a mannequin from an East End tailor's shop bombed in the Blitz

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host this quiz contest, in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win ¬£5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Gyles Brandreth on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Attenborough and the Mammoth Graveyard
programme.desc: David Attenborough joins a team of archaeologists and palaeontologists excavating a mammoth graveyard discovered by fossil hunters in the prehistoric riverbed of the Thames. The site has also led to the discovery of stone artefacts, providing an insight into the relationship between early humans and mammoths during the Ice Ages. Leading experts in the fields of evolution provide their insight into this unique vision of prehistoric Britain

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy arrives on the square and tries to go unseen while she searches for Kathy but her efforts are unsuccessful. Gina, George and Elaine transform the Vic into a Spanish fiesta for Anna's 21st birthday. Peter and Kathy have a heart-to-heart

programme.title: The Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers and Jennifer Reoch present coverage of the annual spectacular at Edinburgh Castle featuring an array of global talent led by the famous Massed Pipes and Drums. Performers include the Trinidad and Tobago Defence Force Steel Orchestra, the Swiss Armed Forces Central Band, His Majesty the King of Norway's Guards and Drill Team, the US Air Force Band, and the RAF King's Colour Squadron

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Lorna has no intention of sleeping until she finds out what Aoife Cassidy knew. The town's laundry survivors campaign for justice, and Lorna discovers that Aoife spoke to another survivor. Colman and local guard Massey join forces to track down Father Percy's murderer. Key evidence has been destroyed, but Colman identifies his murder suspect as Aoife Cassidy, whilst Lorna's strange behaviour brings her to his attention

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Reading & Leeds Festival 2023
programme.desc: Billie Eilish returns to Reading Festival, this time to headline the Main Stage East, where on a sunny afternoon in 2019, she drew arguably the biggest crowd of the weekend. At just 21, she will become the youngest solo artist to headline the event. The LA alt-pop sensation has built a hugely dedicated fanbase, has two UK number 1 albums under her belt When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? And Happier Than Ever and recently joined a stellar cast on the Barbie movie soundtrack with hit What Was I Made For?

In the 800m at 7.45, Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson will hope to go one better than in last year's championships, when she took silver behind USA's Athing Mu. Finals also take place in the women's high jump from 7.05, the men's 5,000m at 7.10, the men's javelin from 7.20, the women's 3,000m steeplechase at 8.10, the men's 4x400m relay at 8.37 and the women's 4x400m relay at 8.47

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Mystery, starring Ruth Wilson as Lorna Brady, who wakes from sleepwalking to find a corpse in her house. She has no idea who the dead woman is or if she's responsible for the apparent murder. Re-tracing her steps, Lorna realises that the mysterious woman could be linked to her past in the town's Magdalene Laundry. Meanwhile in Dublin, Detective Colman Akande is confronted with the murder of a local priest. Tracking the case brings him into Lorna's orbit

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from the latest Premier League fixtures, featuring Newcastle United v Liverpool, Sheffield United v Manchester City and Burnley v Aston Villa. Liverpool overcame the Magpies home and away last term, but Newcastle still beat them to a top-four spot. The Blades faced a tough test against a City side that overcame them 3-0 in the semi-finals of last season's FA Cup, while another newly promoted side in Burnley were looking for a strong display against Unai Emery's men. Plus, a round-up of Friday and Saturday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Extended highlights of St Mirren v Aberdeen at Simple Digital Arena, plus a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Reading & Leeds Festival 2023
programme.desc: The Killers return to the Reading Festival to headline for the second time, having first graced the top spot back in 2008. Nearly 20 years on from the release of their debut album Hot Fuss, expect a setlist full of huge sing-a-long anthems and indie disco classics from the band's seven-strong back catalogue of albums

programme.title: The Woman in the Wall
programme.desc: Lorna has no intention of sleeping until she finds out what Aoife Cassidy knew. The town's laundry survivors campaign for justice, and Lorna discovers that Aoife spoke to another survivor. Colman and local guard Massey join forces to track down Father Percy's murderer. programme.title: Reading & Leeds Festival 2023
programme.desc: Billie Eilish returns to Reading Festival, this time to headline the Main Stage East, where on a sunny afternoon in 2019, she drew arguably the biggest crowd of the weekend. At just 21, she will become the youngest solo artist to headline the event. The LA alt-pop sensation has built a hugely dedicated fanbase, has two UK number 1 albums under her belt When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? And Happier Than Ever and recently joined a stellar cast on the Barbie movie soundtrack with hit What Was I Made For?

programme.title: The Great Food Guys

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Philip and Lorraine in Stockport want to transform their forgotten plot into a stately garden, on a budget of ¬£4,750, with secret passageways, big urns, a beautiful tiled patio and lots of posh planting. Charlie Dimmock takes on the Rich Brothers to come up with a design that would not look out of place in a stately home.

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the evening session on day eight from National Athletics Centre in Budapest, Hungary, where medals are up for grabs in seven events. The decathlon concludes with the javelin from 6.05 and the 1500m at 8.25, and Great Britain will expect to be in contention in the men's and women's 4x100m relays at 8.40 and 8.50 respectively given the wealth of talent at their disposal. The other finals are the men's pole vault at 6.25, the women's shot put from 7.15, the men's 800m at 7.30 and the women's 5,000m, at 7.50

programme.title: Casualty

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Fulham at Emirates Stadium and Manchester United v Nottingham Forest at Old Trafford. The Gunners are aiming to finish one better than last term when they were runners-up, but faced a potentially tough test against a Fulham side that performed well last term. The Red Devils and Forest met four times in all competitions last season, with United winning every contest. Plus, Bournemouth v Tottenham Hotspur, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Everton v Wolverhampton Wanderers, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United and Chelsea v Luton Town

programme.title: Kick-Ass 2 (2013)
programme.desc: Amateur superhero Dave joins a team of like-minded crimefighters, while lethal young vigilante Mindy retires and tries to be a normal teenager. Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Thirty-three-year-old Kiran is looking for a life partner and has decided to lean on her Sikh faith and community to help her find the one. Kiran's parents had an arranged marriage 47 years ago and are happy to put out feelers among friends and relatives. Kiran also visits a matrimonial service at her temple, talks to two different types of Sikh matchmaker and goes to a Sikh speed-dating event. Will she find love?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Attenborough and the Mammoth Graveyard
programme.desc: David Attenborough joins a team of archaeologists and palaeontologists excavating a mammoth graveyard discovered by fossil hunters in the prehistoric riverbed of the Thames. The site has also led to the discovery of stone artefacts, providing an insight into the relationship between early humans and mammoths during the Ice Ages. Leading experts in the fields of evolution provide their insight into this unique vision of prehistoric Britain

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan G√†idheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: AH-AH thinks that there is talent to be found in Allt na Coille when there is a circus event taking place, but doesn't know what talents there actually are

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: When Goraidh is out for a walk, he comes across something strange in the field and he thinks it may be a monster - but what could this terrifying thing be?

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: The Wintry Games are great fun and it looks like Posy is the champion - but is there a secret to be told?

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Ernest meets his old friend L√©on, who he played music with when he was young. L√©on insists that Ernest accompanies him on tour again, but what will C√©lestine do without Ernest?

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: Seal organises a swimming contest in the lake. Owl decides to sign up, but, when he finds out that Tusk will be his opponent, Owl feels intimidated

programme.title: An L√† (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: Torquil Farquhar has just been left stranded on a dummy iceberg in Fraochy Bay as the lifeboat abandons its training sessionand heads off to a real-life emergency. A local crofter is being held hostage by his mutinous sheep

programme.title: Live Scottish League 1 Football
programme.desc: Alloa Athletic v Falkirk (Kick-off 5.30pm). Coverage of the League One match at the Recreation Park

programme.title: Mach √† Seo!
programme.desc: Ramsay MacMahon travels to Stirlingshire for an action-packed few days. He climbs to the top of the Wallace Monument for panoramic views of the countryside and Stirling Castle

programme.title: Leugh Mi (Book Show)
programme.desc: Anna Macleod is joined in conversation by Skye Gaelic singer Eilidh Cormack and TV researcher Euan MacLean from Glasgow, who discuss books of special interest to them

programme.title: Na Tiristich (From Tiree with Love)
programme.desc: Tiree is approximately 12 miles long, five miles wide, and has a population of around 650. Cameras reveal what it is like to live on the most westerly island in the Inner Hebrides

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: A selection of tracks from the world of trad and folk music, including Gnoss, Rachel Newton and De Temps Antan

programme.title: Sgeulachd nam Pola/The Poles Revealed
programme.desc: Science documentary taking viewers on a journey of discovery in the Arctic and Antarctic and revealing just how different these two landscapes are

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum Maclean swims in the River Etive, the water Calum claims is the most fun for a swimmer. Running between Glencoe to the sea, the river is full of amazing pools

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

programme.title: The Queens that Changed the World
programme.desc: The reign of Hatshepsut, one of Egypt's most powerful and successful rulers. For centuries she was known as a king rather than a queen, as she demanded that she was represented as male, complete with a beard, in contemporary depictions. As pharaoh she oversaw immense engineering works, including the construction of the Temple of Deir el-Bahri, developed important trade routes across the region, led expeditions and brought wealth and artistry to the region

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at favourite editions featuring homes full of collections and clutter. In Somersham, Kris and Emily have a ¬£50,000 budget for a first-floor extension to add a fourth bedroom, which Kris thinks will sway Emily back to loving it. But Kirstie is convinced they already have the space they need and embarks on her biggest-ever declutter. They also travel to the Edinburgh suburb of Portobello, where Gary and Bill are at loggerheads over their 19th-century home which is full of Bill's music memorabilia

programme.title: A Cotswold Farmshop
programme.desc: General manager Nuno tries to expand the pastry range with vegan options, while buyer Alex travels to Cinderhill Farm to discover how their popular sausage rolls are made. As autumn sets in, product development manager Sarah decides it's time for a new sweet treat and comes up with an apple cupcake with a cinnamon twist

programme.title: Top Guns: Inside the RAF
programme.desc: Deploying for the first time, pilot Ben faces a life-or-death decision over Syria, while Lossiemouth's station warrant officer prepares for one of the biggest events on the military calendar

programme.title: A Very British Space Launch
programme.desc: The untold story of Anglo-American space company Virgin Orbit's failed attempt to put Britain into the space race. In September 2022, Virgin Orbit, led by Sir Richard Branson, brought their innovative rocket system to Cornwall. Cameras go behind the scenes at Britain's first ever spaceport. The everyday dangers and challenges facing the team are revealed, from damaged rockets to power outages, hazardous tests and the excitement of launch night when, on 9 January 2023, the first launch ended in disaster

programme.title: Boobs

programme.desc: A patient with a rare condition is rushed in to St George's in south west London, struggling to breathe. Her husband tells the story of their child's struggle with leukemia. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicki Bruce, who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent ¬£1.2million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015

programme.title: The Queens that Changed the World
programme.desc: The reign of Hatshepsut, one of Egypt's most powerful and successful rulers. For centuries she was known as a king rather than a queen, as she demanded that she was represented as male, complete with a beard, in contemporary depictions. As pharaoh she oversaw immense engineering works, including the construction of the Temple of Deir el-Bahri, developed important trade routes across the region, led expeditions and brought wealth and artistry to the region

programme.title: Shirley Valentine (1989)
programme.desc: A Liverpudlian housewife is trapped in a humdrum existence and a dull marriage. Fed up, she decides to go on an unheard-of holiday by herself to a Greek island, where she starts to enjoy life again - especially when she is romanced and seduced by a smooth-talking fisherman. Comedy, adapted from Willy Russell's stage play, starring Pauline Collins, Tom Conti, Bernard Hill, Julia McKenzie and Alison Steadman

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: A visit to the picturesque market town of Shaftesbury in the north of Dorset, where the annual Gold Hill Cheese Race is taking place. Elsewhere, experts take viewers on a dive into the natural habitat of the native Spiny seahorses, and there's also a visit to a woodland retreat near Beaminster, where Guy Mallinson has designed and built three unique treehouses

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
