In Stratford-upon-Avon, Ash and Tom are setting up the Adventure Overland Show in preparation for the arrival of 15,000 people at the motorhome festival over the weekend. Tomi Adebayo tests windbreaks to see which he would invest in, and we get a peek inside a luxurious ¬£2million motorhome that boasts internal wing mirrors, LED lit stairs and an extending couch

programme.title: Rich Holiday, Poor Holiday
programme.desc: Retired millionaire Lyn and best friend Hugh swap vacations with hard-up office workers Keisha and Merrit to find out if you really need money to have a good time on holiday. Lyn and Hugh head to Kent for a week in a static caravan, while Keshia and Merritt head to Chamonix in south-eastern Francef or a stay at a luxury wellness chalet in the shadow of Mont Blanc

programme.title: When Holidays Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Accounts of nightmare vacations from those whose dream break went horribly wrong, including a woman horrified to see her young children paddling in what she believed to be sewage. Plus, the beachgoer who found herself upside down and clinging on for dear life during a parasailing excursion we Horribly Wrong, and a day trip to Brighton that ended up a sunseeker being chased by a hungry flock of seagulls. Jenny Powell narrates, with contributors including broadcaster Dermot Murnaghan, travel journalist Simon Calder and DJ Sonny Jay

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 80s Songs
programme.desc: Jackie Brambles narrates this look back at 1989, the era of Madonna, Milli Vanilli and Jason Donovan. Toyah Willcox, Paul Gambaccini, Cheryl Baker and Jenny Powell add their thoughts on the year when the Bangles' Eternal Flame was a huge hit, Lisa Stansfield sang All Around The World, and Jive Bunny and the Mastermixers were almost unstoppable

They try to rebuild their relationship with the boy, who has no memories of his family. Drama based on Jacquelyn Mitchard's novel, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Treat Williams, Whoopi Goldberg and Jonathan Jackson

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again (2018)
programme.desc: A sinister cyber attack reveals the identity of all active undercover agents in Britain. Hapless secret agent Johnny English is sent on a mission to the South of France to protect Queen and country, and find the mastermind hacker responsible. Third movie in the comedy series, starring Rowan Atkinson, Ben Miller and Olga Kurylenko

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Clueless (1995)
programme.desc: A rich high-school student uses all her charm and financial clout to boost an awkward new pupil's image, but soon finds she has created a monster - while her own popularity suffers in the process. Comedy inspired by Jane Austen's Emma, starring Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy and Paul Rudd

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada (2006)
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond (2016)
programme.desc: The USS Enterprise sets out on a rescue mission which turns out to be a deadly trap set by a mysterious warlord. The crew are left stranded on an unexplored planet, and join forces with a fugitive alien scavenger to find a way off the hostile world and prevent a terrible weapon being unleashed upon the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba

programme.title: Life (2017)
programme.desc: A team of scientists on the International Space Station fight for survival when an intelligent alien life form is brought on board. The creature, nicknamed Calvin, proves it will do anything to stay alive, and the crew risk everything to ensure it does not make its way to Earth. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Rebecca Ferguson, Ryan Reynolds and Ariyon Bakare

programme.title: Step Brothers (2008)
programme.desc: Brennan and Dale are two 40-year-old men who have never flown the nest. All that changes when Brennan's mother marries Dale's father, and the spoiled sons are forced to share a room. They take an instant dislike to each other, but when their long-suffering parents finally insist they find jobs, they learn to work together. Comedy, with Will Ferrell, John C Reilly, Mary Steenburgen and Richard Jenkins

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever (1977)
programme.desc: A streetwise Brooklyn teenager struggles to cope with a dead-end job and a dysfunctional family, but finds an escape in the disco scene, where he falls in love with a girl dreaming of breaking free from her equally poor background to pursue a brighter future in Manhattan. Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees

programme.title: Jumanji (1995)
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

programme.title: Daddy Day Care (2003)
programme.desc: Two unemployed executives decide to open a day-care centre, believing they have found an easy way to make a profit - but instead discover looking after a horde of rampant kids is not as simple as it seems. Family comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn and Anjelica Huston

programme.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
programme.desc: Spooky couple Gomez and Morticia hire a nanny to look after their new baby son - and stop him suffering an early death at the hands of his jealous elder siblings. Romance soon blossoms between the new childminder and Uncle Fester, but he does not realise she is planning to kill him once she has got hold of the family fortune. Comedy sequel, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci and Joan Cusack

programme.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (2018)
programme.desc: After being bitten by a radioactive arachnid, student Miles Morales develops incredible abilities, and becomes a version of Spider-Man. When a super collider device opens a gateway to other dimensions, Miles crosses paths with five counterparts to stop a threat for all realities. Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Shameik Moore and Nicolas Cage

programme.title: The Greatest Showman (2017)
programme.desc: After losing his job as a shipping clerk, PT Barnum creates and develops his circus in New York in the mid-1800s with the help of playwright Phillip Carlyle and an adopted family of entertainers shunned by society. Musical drama, starring Hugh Jackman, Zac Efron, Michelle Williams, Rebecca Ferguson and Zendaya

programme.title: Con Air (1997)
programme.desc: Honourably discharged Army Ranger sergeant Cameron Poe hitches a ride home on a maximum-security flight conveying some of America's deadliest criminals. When they hijack the plane in mid-flight, led by criminal mastermind Cyrus the Virus, Poe is forced to intervene. Meanwhile, US marshal Vince Larkin has an ongoing battle on the ground to prevent the plane from being blown to pieces. Director Simon West's blockbusting action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi, Ving Rhames and Colm Meaney

programme.title: Benedetta (2021)
programme.desc: Benedetta Carlini arrives at the Convent of the Mother of God in Pescia, northern Italy as a child. In adulthood, she experiences powerful visions of Jesus, and her proclamations draw crowds to the convent. However, Benedetta's faith is tested by the arrival of a young woman called Bartolomea, who arouses forbidden lust. Paul Verhoeven's controversial drama, starring Virginie Efira, Charlotte Rampling and Lambert Wilson

programme.title: Candyman (1992)
programme.desc: A graduate student is researching urban legends for her dissertation and investigates the tale of a supernatural, hook-handed serial killer rumoured to haunt a run-down Chicago apartment block. Though cynical at first, she soon finds herself face to face with the murderous soul, who sets his sights on claiming her as his latest victim. Horror, starring Virginia Madsen, Tony Todd and Xander Berkeley

programme.title: The Cat in the Hat (2003)
programme.desc: Two bored youngsters are led on a series of zany misadventures when a manic moggy comes knocking at their door with a magical stovepipe hat on his head and mischief in mind. Comedy fantasy based on the children's book by Dr Seuss, starring Mike Myers, Alec Baldwin, Dakota Fanning and Spencer Breslin

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: Puss in Boots (2011)
programme.desc: The swashbuckling feline joins forces with a cunning thief and a treacherous old friend to steal a magical golden goose from a giant's castle. He must save the day when it transpires that their actions have unleashed a terrible danger on his home town. Animated comedy spin-off from the Shrek movies, with the voices of Antonio Banderas and Salma Hayek

programme.title: School of Rock (2003)
programme.desc: A slobbish guitarist dreams of stardom, but his hopes are dashed when the other members of his band kick him out. Struggling to make ends meet, he takes a job as a supply teacher at an exclusive private school, and sets about moulding his pupils into rock gods. Comedy from director Richard Linklater, starring Jack Black, Joan Cusack, Mike White and Sarah Silverman

programme.title: Men in Black 3 (2012)
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: Titanic (1997)
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Cast Away (2000)
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finds herself becoming an overbearing mother when she finds out that Alex has a crush on a boy, and Haley's idea of sisterly advice is not helping matters. Meanwhile, Mitchell and Cameron have an argument over the former's aversion to public displays of affection, and Gloria believes that her grandmother has been visiting in her dreams. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Lego Masters New Zealand
programme.desc: A challenge tests the technical expertise of the teams, who must build a fantastic creation suspended from a wire, with the losers being eliminated

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fell by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. After identifying the most pressing issues at each location, he puts the owners and staff to work as he attempts to save their establishments from disaster. His first stop is Coeur d'Alene, Idaho, where the Roosevelt Inn is more than $1million in debt - and to make matters worse, the owner's wife has had enough

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire prepares the Dunphy household for Halloween, but the rest of the family is less enthusiastic. The spooky goings-on remind Cameron of a traumatic childhood experience, and Gloria is upset when Jay and Manny make fun of her accent

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: While Claire and Haley fall ill at the same time, Phil wages battle against a defective smoke detector after concluding it is saying 'you're not a man' to him. Elsewhere, Manny accidentally gets one of Jay's employees dismissed. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Everyone gathers to celebrate Manny's birthday, but he is in the throes of a mini-crisis about getting older. Meanwhile, Phil and Claire engage in a car race, and Mitch and Cameron get sidetracked. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households, starring Rico Rodriguez, Ty Burrell and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron is delighted when his mother comes to visit, but her presence makes Mitchell feel uncomfortable. Meanwhile, Haley's decision to break up with Dylan hits Phil hard. Guest starring Celia Weston, with Eric Stonestreet and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Luke and Manny prepare for their first school dance, but the rest of the family seems more excited by the occasion. Meanwhile, Mitch and Cameron worry when Lily begins biting other children in the playground. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog (2020)
programme.desc: Sonic, a blue hedgehog who can run at supersonic speeds, is transported to Earth. A decade later, while enjoying life in Montana, his speedy skills create an electromagnetic pulse. Scientific genius Dr Robotnik is hired to investigate, and becomes obsessed with capturing the creature for his power. Live-action fantasy adventure based on the video games, starring James Marsden and Jim Carrey, with the voice of Ben Schwartz

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Mary takes care of a bedridden Mandy and Meemaw, while Sheldon learns the university is building a database without him

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard is put in charge of looking after Stephen Hawking's wheelchair when the famous scientist comes to lecture at the university for a week - and takes advantage of his position to blackmail Sheldon into performing assorted unpleasant tasks. Guest starring Stephen Hawking

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Raj organise a stag party for Howard, but stories about his sexual history are unwittingly revealed, and he has to persuade bride-to-be Bernadette not to call off the wedding. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard tries to use his wedding as an excuse to avoid being sent into space, but ends up accepting the mission. Amy plots to get Sheldon to take the next step in their relationship, while Leonard accidentally asks Penny to marry him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer

Presenters Sandi Toksvig and Noel Fielding guide them through the assorted tasks, while Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith pass judgment on their baking skills. programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, including Sam Ryder and Scott Mills, Rylan and his mother Linda, Judi Love and Charlene White, Paul Sinha and his husband Olly, and Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont, Mo Gilligan with Babatunde Al√©sh√©, Stephen and Anita Mangan, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, and Denise van Outen and Duncan James, comment on the week's TV. Their viewing highlights include Too Hot to Handle, Only Connect, The Proof Is Out There, Smile and The Deepest Breath

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including I'm a Celebrity... South Africa, Obsession, Married at First Sight Australia, Britain's Got Talent, Absolutely Dyer: Danny and Dani Do Italy, Big Beasts, The Yorkshire Vet, and ITV News on the government's phone alarm

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their insightful and passionate takes on TV shows including I'm a Celebrity South Africa, Citadel, The 1% Club, Celebrity Hunted, Britain's Got Talent, Reunion Hotel, and Canal Boat Diaries

programme.title: First Dates

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany visits Gobustan in Azerbaijan, and uncovers 40,000-year-old rock art which tells the tales of the earliest inhabitants of this desert landscape. Plus, George and Will Hardie search for engineering inspiration for their futuristic rotating home

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George meets Amin and Amifa, whose 1920s house in Bellingham, south east London, is not just ugly - the property's DIY extension added by former owners has been condemned. The makeshift kitchen is an accident waiting to happen. The living room is dark and dingy and misaligned windows are not doing anything for its kerb appeal. Enter architect Carl Turner, who has a modest budget of ¬£80,000 to transform this monstrosity. Can he create a contemporary, spacious and adaptable home for this rapidly growing family?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The host takes on a classic 1930s terraced home with a kitchen that's so tiny the fridge and oven have to live in another room. The two mismatched fireplaces are causing marital strife, with one of the couple loving the original 1930s one, and the other favouring the Victorian reproduction. Only one fireplace can stay in George's new art deco-inspired scheme. Plus, he revisits a Victorian home where George previously helped renovate the bottom two floors

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Windsor, Berkshire, the first to host is estate agent Vikki who's hoping to bag the ¬£1000 prize by hosting a ladies day-themed dinner party. The guests she's hoping to impress are entrepreneur and self-proclaimed winner Mohinder, local radio DJ Mary, 66-year-old football-loving Angie and second-hand car dealer Robert. With some gamey golfers, difficult diners and cutting commentary, it promises to be a night her guests won't forget in a hurry

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night in Windsor, and radio DJ Mary hosts an evening featuring traditional Irish dishes like vegetable soup, steak with champ, and an Eton Mess with a twist

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week in Windsor is outspoken entrepreneur Mohinder, who hopes to impress his fellow guests with an ambitious menu featuring tulips and a cauliflower foam

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Windsor is hosted by retired sales manager Angie, who is planning some 1960s fun. However, her guests are not impressed by the rules she lays down at the beginning

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Windsor, Berkshire, car salesman Rob unleashes the mother of all surprises on his guests, welcoming them to his enormous country mansion complete with swimming pool and Ferrari. Estate agent Vicky and radio DJ Mary are smitten by Rob and his house, but for entrepreneur Mohinder it's all too much as he's completely upstaged and realises he is no longer leader of the pack

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Ian and Sam Sugden's Abbey House in Penrith, Cumbria, where the guests are impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms. However, there is some grumbling over breakfast about the bacon

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners stay at Compton House in Newark, Nottinghamshire, which is run by Lisa Holloway - who prides herself on providing a home away from home for her visitors. However, some of the guests have issues with dust and the haddock served at breakfast - and challenge whether a night's stay is worth the price tag

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate welcome their guests to the White Horse, a pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, where they hope an afternoon of morris dancing in front of the cathedral will make a lasting impression. Unfortunately, Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked inside their room by mistake, and there are arguments over tomatoes at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Retired teachers Ed and Jane Mitchell welcome the contestants to the Old Farmhouse, Cheshire, but everyone is shocked to discover they will have to share a bathroom. Meanwhile, Sam and Ian Sugden find an unwelcome surprise underneath their bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day arrives, as the guests gather to find out who has won and to thrash out their differences - from some fishy findings to a reminder of why sorry can be the hardest word. Later on, a heated exchange about cleaning ends in tears

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition takes place in and around Aberdeen, where 32-year-old offshore logistics supervisor Michelle, hopes to win over her guests with her 'Weegie' wit and prove that Glaswegians have more fun. The guests she's out to impress are 46-year-old year farmer Turid, 30-year-old comedy promoter Naz, 28-year-old gas and oil purchasing specialist Sylvian and 21-year-old economics student David. After a tagine with a Glaswegian twist and the mother of all balloon games, what more can she possibly do to charm her guests?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Confident economics undergraduate David is next to host in Aberdeen, but will his student grub earn him 10 out of 10 with his guests? The 1920s Gatsby-themed dress code goes down a storm with almost everyone, on a night featuring food ending up on the floor, smoke alarms going off and some entertaining cocktail-making

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Oil and gas purchasing specialist Sylvian hosts the third dinner party in Aberdeen, hoping her attention to detail and an ambitious global themed menu will be enough to impress her guests. Philippines-born Sylvian's dishes are an East-meets-West affair, starting with Japanese gyoza, followed by a Sumatran rendang and ending with a very British sticky toffee pudding. But dessert turns out to be sticky in more ways than one; cue tears before bedtime from the host

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Aberdeen, it's the turn of comedy promoter Naz to host. If Naz is to stand a chance of winning the competition, he must find a way to placate his guests, nearly all of whom he has managed to offend over the week. Naz is, by his own admission, not the greatest cook and things don't go according to plan and much of his food is burned and difficult to chew. Ever the eternal optimist however, Naz thinks that his humour and conviviality will win over his critics and earn him the grand

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of the competition in Aberdeen finds journalist Turid hoping her home-grown produce will tantalise her guests' taste buds. Can Turid knock Sylvian off the top spot and walk away with the ¬£1,000 prize?

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man with diabetes, whose blood sugar levels are very high. A woman ventures outside her home for the first time in months and ends up collapsed at the end of her drive. A toddler has a temperature of 40 and a heart rate of 216. A man is in severe pain after surgery to repair a hernia and a 92-year-old man falls and can't get up

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-year-old mechanical engineer Graham is rushed into King's College Hospital in south London with a suspected heart attack, and after his brother reminisces about their carefree youth, the doctor suggests Graham's problems may be related to his more recent stressful lifestyle. Meanwhile, 71-year-old Pat is found unconscious by her husband, and 65-year-old Mick is discovered lying in the street with blood coming out of his ear. In both cases, the medics suspect brain haemorrhages, so scans are required

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mark tries to help a car crash patient under police guard, but he seems to be hiding something suspicious in his underpants. Dr Miriam examines a cheerful 82-year-old biker with fractures, who suddenly takes a turn for the worse

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Revisiting some of the most dramatic incidents as Air Ambulance teams battle to save lives, including paraglider Lucasz receiving treatment for multiple fractures

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun digs into his past to help a teenager who is about to be separated from his mother. Claire gets caught between an injured rock climber and her worried parents, while Glassman experiences hallucinations that force him to face up to a personal tragedy

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mark tries to help a car crash patient under police guard, but he seems to be hiding something suspicious in his underpants. Dr Miriam examines a cheerful 82-year-old biker with fractures, who suddenly takes a turn for the worse

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo and Ellis from East Sussex cannot wait to buy a holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca, where they plan to spend every moment in the sunshine indulging their passion for water sports and mountain biking. Laura Hamilton leaves no stone unturned, showing them five properties for their budget of ¬£60,000

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: James first visited Crete over 40 years ago and has always longed to buy a holiday home there. Now that his partner Alison has also fallen in love with the Greek island too, they've both decided to turn their dream into a reality. Ben Hillman helps the couple find a suitable holiday home - ideally a traditional village house - on their budget of ¬£80,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Yorkshire woman single-handedly attempts to open a glampsite in the Italian countryside, while a London family starts an electric bike company in a glamourous Portuguese resort

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items in Gloucestershire, including a rare pre-Second World War exercise bike and a huge set of farmyard scales used to weigh potatoes

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Brighton to meet recycler Cat, who has tons of junk in a series of sea containers. Henry salvages a children's scooter, while Simon constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a man who spent the last years of his life on the Essex coast, and the search for his relatives leads the heir hunters to Wales. Plus, members of a family who have connections to 19th-century transatlantic communications, and details of more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Knockaloe Beg Farm on the Isle of Man, where owners Fiona and John Anderson hope their guests will embrace their green ethos. They kick things off with an afternoon of laser mayhem, and continue the fun the next day by following breakfast with hands-on animal antics

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests head to the Arches on the Isle of Man for their second stay, where owner Phil Routledge hopes to wow them with scenic views and scuba diving at the B&B's own pool. However, some of the owners are dismayed by modern gadgets with a lack of instructions, and even find cobwebs in their rooms

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants arrive at the Trafford in Blackpool, owned by Robbie and John Welling, who are proud of their traditional 'bucket and spade' B&B. The guests are pleasantly surprised, even if previous host Phil is intent on finding dust as a bit of tit-for-tat retaliation, and the afternoon is spent learning the art of making sticks of rock

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Host Julie welcomes the contestants to Sheepy Lodge, Warwickshire, where they are shocked by their surroundings, and disappointed by a variety of things in the rooms. The host puts on some old-fashioned parlour games, before a fierce hide-and-seek contest erupts. At breakfast, Julie frets when she must prepare poached eggs, and is left emotional after the feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival B&B owners meet to settle some scores and discover what they have been paid. Knockaloe Beg Farm owners Fiona and John Anderson tackle criticisms of a missing host at breakfast, and Phil Routledge from The Arches on the Isle of Man takes on Robbie and John Welling from The Trafford in Blackpool about their 'forensic investigation'. After some heated discussion, the winner is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp meet the Pogsons in Harrogate, North Yorkshire and offer advice to the family who are unsure whether to renovate their property or find a new home. After living in their three-bedroom house for 16 years, Carol thinks that it is time for a big change, but Andrew is adamant he is not moving house

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Young meerkat couple Beagle and Huskie become parents for the first time, and spider monkey Kiara is finding it increasingly difficult to bring up her first daughter, Laura. Meanwhile, vets decide to examine painted dog K'mana's ankle because of an old injury, leaving her partner Ville alone to cope with their seven adolescent puppies

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, following staff who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. In the first episode, a terrified terrier known as Tiny arrives after his owner of five years is taken into care, while child-friendly Daisy, a Cairn terrier, is the only one of Wood Green's charges deemed gentle enough for the Kerry family from Peterborough. Plus, Jack Russell Mozart and Zeus, a recently abandoned Staffordshire bull terrier, each try to charm couple Paul and Elf

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Jonathan Broom and his wife Deborah have put everything on hold while he pursues his dream of building a miniature Hollywood Hills-style mansion. They stumble across a scrap of land in north London, but it's fraught with problems and the only way they can complete the ¬£1million home is by sinking half of it six metres below ground. Surrounded on all sides by their neighbours' back gardens, the couple have to dismantle walls and fences and promise to put them back together again, and that's just the start of their difficulties. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix explores south Devon with chef Angela Hartnett, visiting a restaurant in Dartmouth with a reputation for serving some of the UK's finest seafood. They also board a boat to the River Exe Caf√©, a floating restaurant in the middle of the River Exe, and visit an independent restaurant in Totnes

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: More hidden hotels are revealed in Uruguay, Sweden, Scotland, Oman and the Netherlands - from a camouflaged resort perched on the edge of a mountain, to mainland Britain's most isolated hotel. The Kolarbyn Eco Lodge in Sweden is a rustic retreat of 12 hobbit-like huts that are replicas of those built in the forest by people making charcoal from as far back as the 1800s, while in Norfolk, there's a chance to see an unusual 200-year-old building known as Cley Windmill

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors run tests on 89-year-old Alyce, who has been brought to King's by ambulance after falling near her home. She's accompanied by her close friend Linda, and reveals her resolve to make sure she lives long enough to celebrate her next birthday. Soon after, 23-year-old groom-to-be Sean is examined following an epileptic seizure lasting most of the night

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Compilation episode of the most dramatic motorbike incidents the medics have dealt with. The team is pushed to its limit in a bid to save the life of motorcyclist Pete. Ian is in a critical condition after a crash in the Lake District, while in Berkshire, biker Hanna is trapped with multiple injuries after ploughing into a road sign

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics tend to a young mum having a panic attack while out with her son. Cameras also focus on a two-year-old who is running a high temperature

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Comedy actors Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer travel to the picturesque River Usk in south Wales, where Paul's father first taught him to fish as a young child. The duo discuss their respective childhoods and reflect on their own family lives and values. In their cosy cottage accommodation in the heart of the countryside they compare school photographs and Paul serenades Bob with his guitar. Once outside in the picturesque environment, their quarry is the wild brown trout

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer brave the wild lakes of Essex in search of the mighty carp. They have the latest high-tech equipment to catch the biggest fish they can - and are fully prepared to stay all night if they have to. The pair discuss the true meaning of a mid-life crisis and decide to visit a beauty clinic to see whether there are any suitable treatments available to re-capture their youth. Bob reveals his secret recipe to make the perfect scrambled eggs - but it's not the only thing that shocks Paul

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so together with friend Paul Whitehouse, he sets off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They stay in the heart of the Highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and enjoy a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. The duo also reflect on luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives and later assess whether the trip has lived up to their expectations

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The clan's visit to the Second World War graves in Normandy gets off to a bad start when Lucy discovers that her grandfather was not the man she thought he was. In short, this seems to be a piece of family history best left buried. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A family Christmas party turns sour when Lucy announces that she has got tickets to see Jason Donovan in Panto. Lee loathes Panto - especially given the Aussie actor was Lucy's teenage crush. That night, Lee has an unsettling dream in which he is dressed as Buttons and his whole life has turned into a Pantomime. Lucy is Cinderella, Toby and Anna are the Ugly Sisters, Geoffrey is Baron Hardup and Wendy is Fairy Godmother. Worse still, Prince Charming - the handsome suitor who pursues Cinderella and asks for her hand in marriage - is Jason Donovan. Can Buttons keep the fairy-tale couple apart? They celebrate in the only way possible in the south-west of England - it's not particularly heart-healthy but it proves to be very tasty

They discuss their respective bad habits and Bob gives Paul a thorough health update, before they retire to a local hostelry to sample traditional refreshments. Paul demonstrates how to perform life-saving CPR and Bob gives him a glimpse into his future by telling his fortune in an ancient Irish manner

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Investigating what happened to a pirate city in Jamaica, a grim gulag in Croatia and a Louisiana plantation caught up in the aftermath of the American Civil War

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide of 1913, Michael Portillo explores the former domain of the Habsburg monarchs, beginning in the Hungarian capital Budapest. He then travels to Austria via Bratislava in Slovakia, and in Vienna he immerses himself in pre-First World War decadence. From there he heads to Salzburg, before going on to the Salzkammergut region to visit the emperor's Austrian summer residence at Bad Ischl, where in 1914 Franz Joseph I signed a declaration that changed the course of European history

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, beginning his journey in Berlin - which at the beginning of the 20th Century was a powerhouse of science and technology. Led by his copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide of 1913, he heads west via the Harz Mountains to the industrial Ruhr Valley to learn how imperial Germany was ready for war. He then goes south along the tourist trail of the castle-studded Rhine river and ends in the Rheingau to taste the wines of its vineyards

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of early 20th-century travellers, Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Switzerland, which was a favourite with Edwardian tourists. He begins in Basel, travels east to visit the industrial regions of Zurich and learns about the engineering feats needed to thread the rail network through the Alps. He takes in the striking beauty of Lake Lucerne, before ending with an ascent by train to Europe's highest station at Jungfraujoch

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Holland and Belgium, before travelling to the French sector of the Western Front. He ends his journey in the Forest of Compiegne in northern France to hear how the First World War armistice was signed in a railway carriage

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo once again ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. He begins in Spain, where he visits the scene of an assassination attempt at a royal wedding in Madrid, before dancing with an unusual partner in Cordoba. He investigates the story behind Bizet's Carmen at a tobacco factory in Seville, learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor takes up life drawing classes and Margaret is only too happy to see the back of him - until she learns the subject is a nude woman whom he has volunteered to drive home. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Offbeat tourism show in which Richard Ayoade is joined by celebrity guests to enjoy the most efficient weekend break possible. He begins in Barcelona with comedienne and actress Kathy Burke, experiencing the best of this popular holiday destination in just 48 hours. The pair sample adventurous cuisine, including potatoes coated in edible clay, and a cava tasting session quickly descends into disarray. Other highlights include a visit to the Barcelona Football Club museum, a guided tricycle tour, and a trip to see the surrealist work of Catalan artist Joan Miro

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by fellow comedian Adam Hills on a whirlwind weekend in Turkey's largest city. He wants to show The Last Leg host how to holiday with ruthless efficiency, as they cross the River Bosphorus from Europe to Asia, comparing a private yacht tour with the low-price public ferry. The pair have an authentic Turkish shave at a local barbershop that turns out to be a lot closer than they were expecting, and share an awkward moment at a local bath and massage parlour. There's also a visit to the Grand Bazaar market, where both men have a go at haggling

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade takes actress and writer Jessica Hynes on a whirlwind weekend away to Iceland, a country famous for spectacular water features, geo-thermic pools and a curious belief in elves - all attributes that the pair investigate with ruthless efficiency. They go on the popular Golden Circle Tour of the Nordic island's most famous waterfalls, glaciers and geysers - by helicopter, saving seven valuable hours. They also eat rotten shark and Brenavin, a spirit made from mashed potato, and attend elf school, followed by a speedy boat trip in search of whales. There's also a rapid chill-out at the Blue Lagoon geothermic pool and spa

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by comedy actor Stephen Mangan for a weekend in the Moroccan city. Wanting to experience its famous street food, the pair sample a local delicacy of steamed sheep's head - an eye-opening culinary experience for them both. They then take a hot-air balloon flight over the Atlas Mountains with breathtaking views, watch a traditional story-telling performance and visit the historic Saadian tombs, as well as Marrakech's ancient tanneries. Finally, in search of a suitable place to sum up the holiday experience, Richard and Stephen head into the desert for a contemplative camel ride

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade explores the Austrian capital in the company of his IT Crowd co-star Chris O'Dowd. Over a packed mini-break, they sample the city's finest sausages, cakes, wines and spirits and visit fairgrounds, cafes and sewers, while Richard suffers an allergic reaction and Chris breaks something valuable

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade goes hurtling through a ruthlessly efficient mini-break in Paris with presenter and comedian Mel Giedroyc. Their base is a chic hotel famed for being the place where Oscar Wilde died, but there's no time to hang about soaking up the literary atmosphere, as they head to the Montparnasse Tower for arguably the best view of Paris, and one which has the bonus of including the Eiffel Tower. There's also calf's head casserole and snails, a scooter tour, 'green fairy' absinthe, a Cordon Bleu cookery school, bespoke perfume and an art tour

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by Noel Fielding for a quickfire 48-hour break in Danish capital Copenhagen, where they join a cycle tour of the city, sample some stunning sandwiches and visit an underground art gallery. They also find the time for a trip to the Tivoli Gardens and taste Danish pastries and beer at the Carlsberg Brewery

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: In the company of comedian Rob Delaney, Richard Ayoade packs his carry-on case and sets off to enjoy an optimal two-day mini city break in Seville, southern Spain. On arrival, the duo soon learn to dance flamenco and eat tapas and churros. They also explore Metropol Parasol, one of the boldest pieces of modern architecture in Europe and visit a film set built for the spaghetti western A Fistful of Dollars. After seeking to channel their inner Eastwood, the amigos repair to the saloon for some Fanta and a Kinder egg

Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration

programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses into West Yorkshire to begin the next leg of his journey, visiting the Worth Valley and the home of the three Bronte sisters, who were early investors in the railway industry. He then heads to Oakworth to find out how its station and tracks were used in one of the most popular films ever made, and in Bradford discovers the ways in which 19th-century workers saved to buy a home. The presenter finishes in Halifax, where he learns how the railways contributed to the town's success

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This week's competition comes from in and around Chelmsford, where the first host, NHS nurse Sam, throws a doctors and nurses-themed dinner party to win ¬£1000

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Chelmsford, sales manager Elliot hopes to impress his guests with his mum's Guyanese recipes on his Carribean party themed night. Health centre manager Mia is worried about the menu as she doesn't like curries while vegan business owner Russ has made it clear he likes his food hot

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business owner Russell prepares a vegan menu for his guests at his black tie and slippers party on the third night in Chelmsford. His play for the prize is anything but straightforward and leaves his guests guessing about his game plan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's night four in and around Chelmsford, and 'fabulous' Fran - nurturing, kind and always ready to go extra - brings some razzle dazzle to her night. She's determined to raise the bar with her food and make an all-out stab at grabbing the ¬£1,000 cash prize. But will her halloumi stack impress her guests? And will her competitive streak knock their sublime confidence in their own abilities?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in and around Chelmsford, health centre manager Mia aims to impress her guests with some Iberian cuisine. NHS nurse Sam cannot make head nor tail of the menu, while vegetarian charity director Fran is worried that Mia could be serious competition as she's been very critical and given little away about herself all week. Vegan business owner Russ is intrigued to see if Mia can step out of the shadows and blow them all away with her food and hosting skills, while sales manager Elliot isn't convinced by the menu or the prospect of Mia's planned soiree

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: East Anglia is the setting as another three couples try to prove they are the best when it comes to throwing a dinner party. Flashy Paul and Jill kick things off with an Indian buffet, inspired by their regular trips abroad. On day two, young lovebirds Tom and Bonnie try to save their bacon with a breakfast-themed evening, before gym bunnies Neil and Emma swap weights for scales in an attempt to live up to t heir guests' high expectations. But who will grab the grand?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: For Dave and Kelly Elly there's never been another island that compares to Lanzarote. They holidayed there as just friends five years earlier, and now they're married cannot wait to buy a holiday home to enjoy with their families. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their ¬£160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo and Ellis from East Sussex cannot wait to buy a holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca, where they plan to spend every moment in the sunshine indulging their passion for water sports and mountain biking. Laura Hamilton leaves no stone unturned, showing them five properties for their budget of ¬£60,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Liz and Dave celebrate their silver wedding anniversary by finding their dream holiday home in Fuerteventura on a budget of ¬£120,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Semi-retired children's nurse Tracey is looking for a holiday home in La Duquesa on Spain's Costa del Sol and she brings along her friend Jackie for moral support. Property expert Jasmine Harman has five attempts to find Tracey the perfect place on a budget of ¬£140,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Southampton couple David and Sonia five fantastic properties for their budget of ¬£100,000 in the Almeria province of southern Spain

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud reviews the progress of Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs, who set out three years previously to turn a dilapidated 18th-century manor house in the remote Creuse region of central France into a B&B. At the time, he was concerned to find they did not speak the language, planned to do most of the work themselves and only had enough money to survive for a year

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr, Susie Dent and Rachel Riley host a compilation of best bits from the anarchic letters and numbers game, featuring Sean Lock, Jon Richardson, Joe Wilkinson, Lucy Beaumont, Bob Mortimer, Rosie Jones, Paul Foot, Kevin Bridges, Nick Helm and Victoria Coren-Mitchell among others

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an A&E department returns for its first series outside London - at the Queen's Medical Centre, Nottingham. Sister Lou tells her story of working at the hospital for more than 30 years and how her life completely changed in her 50s. Forty-five-year-old Kirsty has been rushed into QMC after an accident at a fun run. The team members carry out extensive tests on 93-year-old John, who is suffering from shortness of breath, and in the children's emergency unit, seven-year-old Hunter is being assessed after falling from a tree

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including The Traitors, Gino's Cooking up Love, Lady Chatterley's Lover, I Can See Your Voice, Blowing LA, This Morning and White Christmas

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a big fat night of pointless sports trivia, with panellists Roisin Conaty, Judi Love, Joel Dommett, Dane Baptiste, Kerry Godliman and Tom Allen pondering why Paula Radcliffe apologised to the nation, which sports have been played on the moon, and what trademarks belong to Muhammad Ali. Charles Dance heads up the celebrity question setters, alongside the kids of Mitchell Brook Primary School

programme.title: Top Guns: Inside the RAF
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes - and in the cockpit - with the personnel at RAF Lossiemouth, as global tensions, including with Russia, impact on missions both at home and abroad. In the first episode, RAF pilot Jake Desmond is sent to NATO's frontline to face off against three Russian jets, and rookie pilot Harry Brooks tries to earn his wings and qualify for live operations

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day sees emotions are running high as the B&Bers pour over their assessments. Derwent House Apartments are up first, with the hosts keen to turn up the heat on Jane and Sharon's facilities feedback. Gemma and Mark from Burton Constable Holiday Park want to get the buzz on some cleanliness concerns, before Stephen from The Crossings Inn asks for answers about some comments that gave him the chills. Accusations fly as payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Abbey Court Guest House in Carlisle. After an afternoon of abseiling, the wastage at breakfast leaves some with a bad taste in their mouths

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals are glamping at Holly Grove Farm in Staffordshire. Hosts Dave and Karon believe it is a rural idyll and their guests agree - apart from one, who is not happy with their size of their hut

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers, before discovering who has won the latest competition. Abbey Court Guest House's Kelly wants to sink her teeth into her breakfast score, while The Lime Tree Inn operators have some qualms about Pav's facilities comments. Pav's under the microscope again for the poor sleep score he gave Holly Grove Farm, before he cleans up everyone's cleanliness concerns

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Creates Monmouth in Monmouthshire, where a peaceful night's sleep is ruined by an early morning fire alarm and a lack of privacy bothers one guest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals stay over at Coastal Park Accommodation in Llanelli, where an evening drinks session turns tense when Billy confronts hosts Claire and Tony about their business model

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners converge at Caroline Weaver's Whychurch Farm Glamping in Wiltshire. Kenny and Ben are pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness, but Billy and Tracy feel a little cramped in their pod. A day spent helping out on the on-site farm isn't to everyone's taste, but an evening barbecue is a massive hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day finds the B&Bers ready to settle some scores. First to get some answers on their feedback are Kenny and Ben, who want to take a peek at Caroline's privacy issues and reveal why they found her sleep score alarming. Next, Tony and Claire confront Kenny and Ben on a 'wee problem', and chew over Billy and Tracy's breakfast score - who in turn want to clear up Claire and Tony's cleanliness comments

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their ¬£300,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps husband and wife, George and Lennox Thomas find their ideal holiday home in and around the Spanish area of Marina Almeria to escape their busy London lives. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Jane find a holiday home with a sea view on the Portuguese island of Madeira on a budget of ¬£200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Originally from Lithuania, Reda met Greg while she was working at a hotel in London. Now, almost nine years later, they have sold their home and are all set for a life in Spain and to enjoy everything the country has to offer. Lee lines up five great options, within their budget of ¬£100,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Amanda and Keith from Wiltshire enlist Leah Charles-King's help searching for a holiday home in the hillside villages of western Cyprus with a budget of ¬£250,000. After meeting in the RAF, the couple have been together for 31 years and hope that eventually the home will become a permanent place they can retire to

programme.title: PopMaster TV
programme.desc: Ken Bruce presents a TV version of his famous mid-morning radio quiz, in which players compete to impress with their knowledge of popular music from the 1950s to the present day. programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary recording daily life inside Woodgreen animal charity. The team continues with its mission to find homes for abandoned dogs. programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: The Big Fat Quiz of Everything

Charles Dance heads up the celebrity question setters, alongside the kids of Mitchell Brook Primary School

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an A&E department returns for its first series outside London - at the Queen's Medical Centre, Nottingham. Sister Lou tells her story of working at the hospital for more than 30 years and how her life completely changed in her 50s. Forty-five-year-old Kirsty has been rushed into QMC after an accident at a fun run. The team members carry out extensive tests on 93-year-old John, who is suffering from shortness of breath, and in the children's emergency unit, seven-year-old Hunter is being assessed after falling from a tree

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA

He meets an artist who is drawn to the landscape and lends a hand to the rangers closing an old, abandoned gold mine. In Arizona, Matt learns how desert crop-growing relies on the Colorado river

programme.title: A Cotswold Farmshop
programme.desc: Bini currently supplies the service station freezer with nine of her delicious ready-made curries, all made using locally sourced ingredients, but she's keen to add to her range. programme.title: Beat the Chef

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first in a week of dinner parties from in and around Bristol. Up first is Jade, who throws a festival-themed evening with its own drum and bass rave. programme.desc: The third host of the week is dance enthusiast and property developer Joe who creates an evening dedicated to the happiness of holidaying with a taste of Dominican food for his guests. Will his Caribbean theme be paradise or purgatory?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jazz musician Jack puts on an evening of vintage couture, sophistication and class, and his rivals in and around Bristol embrace the theme. However, the host's timings and temperature make it hard not to notice the pressure he has put himself under

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Gary and Susie Gillhooly, who want to start a new adventure in Florida's beautiful Sarasota Keys. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Chelmsford, sales manager Elliot hopes to impress his guests with his mum's Guyanese recipes on his Carribean party themed night. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business owner Russell prepares a vegan menu for his guests at his black tie and slippers party on the third night in Chelmsford. His play for the prize is anything but straightforward and leaves his guests guessing about his game plan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Semi-retired children's nurse Tracey is looking for a holiday home in La Duquesa on Spain's Costa del Sol and she brings along her friend Jackie for moral support. Property expert Jasmine Harman has five attempts to find Tracey the perfect place on a budget of ¬£140,000

He is suffering from a history of depression and heart problems, but his only hope of getting emergency accommodation is a note from a doctor. Dr Jackie Bulger comes to the aid of a regular patient suffering an anxiety attack in the waiting room, and Dr Zareena Hyder treats a woman with an unusual form of arthritis that causes her skin to dry out

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: Advanced clinical practitioner Chantelle orders an urgent CT scan to assess whether 79-year-old John has sustained any brain damage after falling at home and cracking his head. To complicate matters, John has a large cancerous growth on his cheek that has also been caught during the fall

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene

programme.title: Making a Serial Killer

programme.title: My Lover, My Killer
programme.desc: The murder of Evie Adams, a young woman who died of an overdose which was planned and executed by her partner, Jordan Monaghan

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Documentary highlighting alarming tales from all sides of the buy-to-let system, drawing attention to stories of unruly tenants who refuse to pay their dues and rogue landlords who have failed to live up to their responsibilities. The series also turns the spotlight on dishonest letting agents who have taken advantage of their position of trust to profit at the expense of both property owners and their tenants

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: One of Jessica's former students publishes a best-selling novel, much to the excitement of the citizens of Cabot Cove - but their delight turns to dismay as fiction begins to mirror reality. Murder mystery, starring Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Montana to celebrate the publication of a dead fellow author's final novel and embarks on yet another murder investigation, forcing her to read between the lines to discover the identity of the culprit. Angela Lansbury stars, with Steve Forrest and Michael Learned of The Waltons fame

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is delighted to run into an old friend while on a shopping expedition in Boston - until he unaccountably denies knowing her. She recruits her dependable ally Harry McGraw to help solve the mystery. Jerry Orbach guest stars

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica takes time out from writing to visit her nephew - but soon has to put on her thinking cap to solve the murder of a TV sports personality. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury and Paul Sorvino

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jessica receives a visit from Eudora McVeigh, a rival mystery writer with seemingly friendly intentions - but the discovery of a corpse in Cabot Cove leads her to suspect the woman of sinister motives. Starring Angela Lansbury and Jean Simmons

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Seth lies critically ill in hospital, the doctor reveals he was poisoned, but Jessica suspects someone else was the intended victim and decides to confront Eudora. Jean Simmons guest stars

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A trip to Paris - and a chance encounter with a British agent friend - sees Jessica re-routed to Athens, where she gets embroiled in an intriguing mix of murder and espionage. Richard Todd and Ian Ogilvy guest star, with Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Cabot Cove's new priest takes a murderer's confession, and asks Jessica to help him uncover the truth without breaking his sacred oath of absolute confidentiality. Starring Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: The death of an elderly writer prompts Jessica to recall an intriguing mystery that happened aboard the Queen Mary some 50 years previously. Guest starring Robert Vaughn, with Angela Lansbury and June Havoc

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Palm Springs to check on an investment and finds herself drawn into solving the murder of a property developer. She initially believes the dead man's wife is guilty of the crime, but the suspect's subsequent suicide complicates matters further. Elliott Gould guest stars

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica Fletcher recounts the unusual tale of a private eye who reluctantly recruited a new partner in the form of a French poodle, which once belonged to a murder victim. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When several unconnected people are shot at point-blank range in New York, the team is called to investigate whether it is the work of a serial killer or more than one murderer

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents receive reports that a member of the BAU team may have been injured by a bomb that exploded in a vehicle in New York. While trying to determine the extent of the damage and apprehend those responsible, the team learns the incident was a diversion so that terrorists could carry out an assassination of a VIP at a nearby hospital. Drama, starring Kirsten Vangsness

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU investigates a 'he-said, she-said' case when a woman crashes a wedding to accuse her therapist of sexual assault. Hard-hitting and emotional drama, directed by Lucy Liu and starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a pregnant teenager refuses to name the father of her baby, Benson and the SVU team investigate. Starring Mariska Hargitay, Kelli Giddish and Ice-T

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An enigmatic killer shoots dead a businessman spending Thanksgiving at a hotel in the city, then takes his glasses, jewellery and ID to Washington Dulles airport, which has been brought to a stand-still by a massive snowstorm. As the murderer's actions take effect, a terror alert is issued, leaving all northern US airports in a state of panic, and leaving it up to DiNozzo, Bishop and her husband - all of whom are trapped at Dulles by the weather - to bring the armed villain to justice. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherley

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is attacked and killed just hours after a serial rapist is freed on parole, prompting McCoy to pull out all the stops to bring him to justice - but before long the detective realises the wanted man could be innocent. Drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A carjacking turns nasty when an off-duty police officer is killed and the driver is kidnapped. Luckily, Briscoe and Curtis capture one of the perpetrators, who offers to reveal the whereabouts of the missing driver to DA Ross - in exchange for immunity on the cop-killing charge. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice.
